gov.usgs.anss.picker

Class TemplatePicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
        • gov.usgs.anss.picker.CWBPicker
          • gov.usgs.anss.picker.TemplatePicker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ManagerInterface, java.lang.Runnable

    public class TemplatePicker
extends CWBPicker
    This class is the template for a picker. It just process the arguments and when apply is called, just saves some history. 
     Switch arg      Description
 -empty         Do nothing switch
 -tpdbg         Turn on the debugging variable to get more log output
 -config file   Set the configuration (template) filename

        public long getWarmupMS()
        Description copied from class: CWBPicker
        Get number of millis the method needs in order to warm up on a segmented call. Often this is just at static variable that is place in the picker implementatino class. 
         public long getWarmupMS() {
   return WARMUP_MS;
 }

      • apply

        public void apply(java.util.GregorianCalendar current,
                  double rate,
                  int[][] idata,
                  int npts)
        Called whenever a blocklen of data comes in with that data for all channels configured. Process a new chunk of data - in this case just demean it, save some history and return
        Specified by:
        apply in class CWBPicker
        Parameters:
        current - The time of the first point of the time series
        rate - Digitizing rate in Hz
        idata - Array with 3 components of data
        npts - Number of points in each time series.

      • clearMemory

        public void clearMemory()
        Description copied from class: CWBPicker
        this will be called when a gap in the data is detected to allow the picker to reset its history or other parameters. Normally this is resetting filters and warmup periods for handling a gap. 
         public void clearMemory() {
   filter.initialize();
   cfg.getDetectors().initialize();
   Arrays.fill(stack, 0.f);
 }
        Specified by:
        clearMemory in class CWBPicker

      • writestate

        public void writestate()
        There is really nothing in this simple example to save in the state file, so just put the config file as an example

        This method builds a StringBuilder of the state file parameters specific to the extending picker for key-value pairs that change over time (not things in the template) and then calls the parent writeState(StringBuilder) to actually combine and write the state file. For many pickers this will do nothing, others might record a background noise level to help the picker warmup quicker, etc. 

         public void writestate() {
   synchronized (statussb) {
     Util.clear(statussb);
     statussb.append("configfile#").append(configFile).append("\n");  // save the config file
     writeStateFile(statussb);
   }
 }
        Specified by:
        writestate in class CWBPicker

      • setArgs

        public final void setArgs(java.lang.String s)
                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                          java.io.IOException
        The CWBPicker handles many arguments from the state file itself. These are : Title, Starttime, Endtime, NSCL, CWBipaddress,CWBport Blocksize, Agency, Author and PickDBServer Each picker can have addition data specific to that picker. The extending class needs to define these are read the in setArgs() and provide them as a StringBuilder in the writestate() method when it calls writeStateFile of the parent class. The user can use the static statesb variable to make the state, but needs to synchronize its usage. Example : 
           public final void setArgs(String s) throws FileNotFoundException, IOException {   
   try {
     BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new StringReader(s));
     for(;;) {
       int len = Util.stringBuilderReadline(in, line);
       if(len < 0) break;
       if(line.indexOf("=") >= 0) continue;     // Its from the CWBPicker part of the template
       if(line.indexOf("!") >= 0) line.delete(line.indexOf("!"), line.length());
       if(line.length() == 0) continue;
       if(line.indexOf("#") > 0) {
         Util.clear(key).append(line.substring(0, line.indexOf("#")));
         Util.clear(value).append(line.substring(line.indexOf("#")+1));
         if(Util.stringBuilderEqualIgnoreCase(key,"-dbg")) dbg=true; // User if/else if to parse all parameters
         else prt("**** Unknown tag in state file s="+line);
       }
     }
   }
   catch(IOException e) {
     
   }
 }
        Specified by:
        setArgs in class CWBPicker
        Parameters:
        s - String with all of the state file parameters not handled by CWBPicker - i.e. those for the specific picker
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if one occurs
        java.io.IOException - if one occurs

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Description copied from class: CWBPicker
        The extending class needs to set the terminate variable to true in its concrete method. It also do anyhting it needs to do to shutdown normally like closing files, making a log entry 
         public void terminate() {
   prta(Util.clear(statussb).append("Terminate() has been called - close and write state"));
   if (maker != null) {
     maker.close();
   }
   writestate();
   terminate = true;
   ready = false;
 }
        }
        Specified by:
        terminate in interface ManagerInterface
        Specified by:
        terminate in class CWBPicker
